page.title: 04HOUSING:DESIGN FEATURES
page.content: Originally they were built to house the coastguards. The newer dwellings are mostly detached houses and bungalows on in-fill sites, although there are some small groups (estates) recently built. In an area near the coast, at Eccles, there is a large estate, the Bush Estate, with a variety of types of dwellings; wooden Chalets, and some bungalows. {DESIGN FEATURES Double-glazing of windows is becoming increasingly desirable on this Eastern side of Norfolk, and many of the newer dwellings have this feature, as a protection against the bitting East wind. The older types of homes had small windows and thicker walls, and often, elabrate porches as their protection.
